main event: A bright light was observed in the sky near Tehran, Iran on September 18-19, 1957, which exhibited unusual movements and behavior.
interesting points: The light was estimated to be 3-4 times brighter than the planet Venus.
The light approached to within 40-50 km of the Mehrabad Airport in Tehran, hovered, then accelerated rapidly and disappeared to the north.
The light changed in size, dimmed and brightened intermittently during the 50-minute observation.
A jet interceptor was scrambled to investigate, but its radio and instruments went off as it approached the object, which then suddenly accelerated and disappeared.
A second scrambled jet also failed to make visual contact with the object.
sighted object: a bright, circular light in the sky
witnesses: control tower operator at Mehrabad Airport, pilots of scrambled jets
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
